Posts.Content: I just went through this whole thing and I thought the anxiety would almost surely kill me.  I had my first mammo, they wanted more films, they called me back. The doc wanted to do a needle biopsy, then a surgical biopsy.  It wasn't cancer, but I'm still high risk because it was abnormal cells.  They were calcifications.
Posts.Title: Breast biopsy scheduled, scared.

Posts.Content: I had a biopsy after microcalc.  It was standard operating procedure. I'm glad I did. The first one was just a stereotactic needle biopsy and then a surgical one.  Everything came back fine, but I am glad I did it.  Peace of mind.  I was scared but I knew it was better to know now than to wait and find out down the road I could have caught something early.  Get the 2nd op and make sure.  You want to sleep at night.  Good luck.
Posts.Title: Microcalcifications-should I wait for a biopsy?

Posts.Content: Has anyone been there and have any experience with the doctors?  I'm schedule to go on Sept 20 for a 4th opinion.
Posts.Title: Weill Cornell Breast Center

Posts.Content: Hi Frayda-
Posts.Title: Weill Cornell Breast Center

Posts.Content: I had a reduction a few years ago and developed a large lump around the incision.  I lived w/it for years until I had to have a biopsy and asked them to remove while in there.  It turned out to be just scar tissue.
Posts.Title: lump in scar tissue?

Posts.Content: Just to give you a good outcome story. I had the cluster microcalcifications and it turned out to be pre-cancerous..which means it's not cancer but could become cancer down the road.  I was beside myself with worry.  My cousin who had the same thing happen told me, don't worry until you have to worry.  That was good advice.  Hang in there and let us know what happens.  This is more common than you think.  I think I read something that said up to 90% of all biopsies come back normal or not cancer. I don't know how accurate that is, but I remember seeing something like that.
Posts.Title: Calcifications in both breasts

Posts.Content: I had it removed.  Now the docs are recommending Tamoxifen to help keep me from having cancer.  Hang in there and let us know how it goes.
Posts.Title: Calcifications in both breasts

Posts.Content: What are the side effects (if any) that you are experiencing/experienced.
Posts.Title: For those you have taken or are currently on Tamoxifen

Posts.Content: Kathy-good luck with it.  I guess after Chemo, Tamoxifen isn't that bad.  I'm going to visit with my Gyno and talk to him.  I know I will eventually go on it but I really have to decide if I'm going to have kids first.  I'm not getting any younger.
Posts.Title: For those you have taken or are currently on Tamoxifen
My surgery catastrophe!!!!!
Haven't been here in a while-confused

Posts.Content: The anticipation is always the worst I guess
Posts.Title: For those you have taken or are currently on Tamoxifen

Posts.Content:
The biggest fear I have about
 the side effects are the thickening uterus and of course the chance of uterine cancer and the hot flashes.
Posts.Title: For those you have taken or are currently on Tamoxifen

Posts.Content:
Hi all-I pray that you are all holding up and plugging along.  A while back I had an abnormal mammo, stereotactic and a excisional biopsy for what is lobular carcinoma in situ..according to the docs, not cancer, but pre-cancer.  I've seen two oncs about
 further treatment and they both recommended Tamoxifen.  I am on the fence about
 whether the reward outweighs the risks.  I am higher risk than a woman who never had this, but the side effects sound almost as bad as seeing what happens. (that is scary enough I guess)  The other thing is we may want to have kids..I'm 38, so maybe one kid, but if I go on Tamoxifen (5 years),  that's that.
Posts.Title: Haven't been here in a while-confused

Posts.Content: You are all wonderful to care so much.  I guess my problem is that I don't have BC, but I am higher risk for it down the road since having this DX. I can consider myself lucky that this was found because the doc said that this is usually not seen on a mammogram unless it's a mass, by then it's infiltrating.
Posts.Title: Haven't been here in a while-confused

Posts.Content: Thanks for listening..and responding..
Posts.Title: Haven't been here in a while-confused

Posts.Content: Thanks. I guess a big jump could indicate something.  Do you think small increases mean anything?
Posts.Title: Tumor Markers-what levels are normal and is this reliable

Posts.Content: So I finally got the blood test results back from Dr. Quack and the CEA and CA levels are within normal range.  Would it be lower or higher than normal range if it was indicating a tumor marker.  The CEA is less than 0.5 and the CA 27.29 is 23.
Posts.Title: Tumor Markers-what levels are normal and is this reliable

Posts.Content: I had a stereotactic and I had to get there 15 min early. It was for paperwork, explaining the procedure etc.. Good luck and let us know how it goes.
Posts.Title: What to expect tomorrow--FNA?

Posts.Content: I'm praying for a pork chop bone!
Posts.Title: Update on me

Posts.Content: First, 103 is not diabetes.
Posts.Title: A poll, please....

Posts.Content: Congrats on your son's engagement. Something to look forward to!  Also him becoming an attorney!
Posts.Title: Frayda

Posts.Content: Frayda-I'm in NYC...I'll come and virtually hold your hand.  I'll be happy to drive anyone that wants to come with me!  Pink Capris and all.  I also have Crohns and I deal with those tests too...i know how you feel.  I have so many doctors for such a healthy person!
Posts.Title: Can the PCE make a stop in NJ tomorrow?

Posts.Content: Are you guys kidding, I need to be heavily medicated.  Especialy since the onc I went to after the surgery was a quack.  I called the surgeon and I'm still waiting for a call back. I found out that the doc I went to was not the doc he wanted me to go to.  There is another doc in the practice and he wanted me to see her.  Sooooooo, I will make an appt and go back.  I so don't want to do this.  I know there's nothing there but I feel like I have a team of docs for a disease I may never get.  This lump has to be scar tissue, it's right by the incision. As far as the self exams, I have been doing them since I was about 20.  Funny, though, my husband found it this time.
Posts.Title: Found a lump-but I think it's scar tissue

Posts.Content: You said you wouldn't be back if it was bad news.  I hope you just decided to go out and celebrate the good news instead of returning. Still praying B9B9B9B9
Posts.Title: Snufflesmom

Posts.Content: I had an excisional biopsy a month ago with a reduction and it's healing, but I did a light exam on myself and to the left of the incision is a lump that doesn't hurt.  It feels like scar tissue.  The reason I know this is because I had some scar tissue removed (it also was a lump). It feels the same and I'm not due go back to the doc until May 2.  I'm a little nervous but I'm trying not to panic.  They found lobular hyperplasia in the biopsy.  Has anyone else experienced this?
Posts.Title: Found a lump-but I think it's scar tissue

Posts.Content: ok, what's a pork chop bone?
Posts.Title: Good news??? Cancel the PCE for Cinti (and let's all head for Cleveland!)...
Messgaes to Becky's Family

Posts.Content: After having an excisional biopsy to further diagnose the abnormal finding of lobular hyperplasia, my doc told me that I should go see an Onc. doc to see if I'm high risk enough to be on Tamoxifen to prevent getting cancer down the road.  I met with her and my husband and right away we knew something was wrong.  She had papers scattered all over her desk and she was trying to put together the history, needle biopsy, lumpectomy, the pathology.. etc.  She couldn't make head or tails out of the pathology or the procedures I had all the while I was telling her the history.  She even went as far as getting the surgeon on the phone to confirm dates.  She told me I'm at stage 0 and it's pre-cancerous.  My surgeon and the pathologist report did not indicate that.  She said it doesn't matter and either way I should be on Tamoxifen.  The surgeon told me there is a risk assessment tool they use to assess your risk.  She didn't do any risk assessment except to confuse my pathology.
Posts.Title: I'm Really Confused after my visit to the Onc Doc kind of long

Posts.Content: Thanks Deb, I really appreciate your help.  I just called my surg onc's office and left his secy a message about the blood work and the Oncologist he referred me to.  I will probably get a call tomorrow night because he is in surgery all day tomorrow.  I need to tell him about my experience and get the results of the blood work.  I need to close the loop on this.  Now, if the recommendation is to take this drug, I have some decisions to make about having kids..if at all.  This really sucks!  On top of this, I have crohns which is just a joy!  A whole other team of docs there...
Posts.Title: I'm Really Confused after my visit to the Onc Doc kind of long
I'm Really Confused after my visit to the Onc Doc kind of long

Posts.Content: I've got the pink capris.  I'm running to catch the flight.  Chanting all the while B9, B9, B9, B9.  Good luck Randi, we will be with you.
Posts.Title: PCE boarding to be with Snufflesmom (Randi)....

Posts.Content: Yay for you Jean!  I wish you an easy treatment and glad to hear it's not Chemo.  Be well and thanks for the info.
Posts.Title: Oncotype DX Test Back...Good News

Posts.Content: There are so many medical miracles in life, why can't there be a cure for BC.  They can create drugs that give a man an erection but not cure this dreaded disease.  I feel for each and every one of you ladies undergoing treatment, dealing with tests and recovery.  It gets me so pissed off that we have to endure such trauma.
Posts.Title: Gets Me Mad

Posts.Content: B9B9B9B9B9B9B9B9B9
Posts.Title: Today I find out if it is Cancer or B9

Posts.Content: thanks for bumping this question.  I really like the reference.  I'm thinking about all the ways I can incorporate it in my life, not just my health!
Posts.Title: Anyone remember the pork chop bone story??

Posts.Content: Is there a risk assessment tool that Oncs use for determining if someone should be on preventative therapies for BC?
Posts.Title: Risk Assessment

Posts.Content: Deb, I don't know why nobody has reported her other than I found out that her colleague who works in that group is really a great doc and I should have seen her instead of the other one. She even had blood taken a week and half ago and said that she would call me. My surgeon didn't even call me and the only thing I can think of is that they didn't find any high tumor marker readings and that's that. I see my regular doc next Saturday whom I trust completely. He has been my doc for 20 years and has never steered me wrong. I am going to discuss this with him at length and get all my reports. I'm tired of doing this already. I have a team of docs now for someone who doesn't have cancer. Jeez! After I meet with him I will do what he suggests. I use the what would you do if it was your wife routine. Some of these docs are just awful and they are left to practice medicine on unsuspecting people. She also kept me waiting 40 minutes in the waiting room and her staff didn't tell me she wasn't back from rounds at the hospital yet. If I saw her on the street I would spit at her!
Posts.Title: I'm Really Confused after my visit to the Onc Doc kind of long

Posts.Content: Started around 14...late bloomer
Posts.Title: age at onset of menses

Posts.Content: My very first mammo showed calcifications that were not normal.  So, I went for more films, then a needle biopsy and finally a removal of more tissue (lobular hyperplasia).  The biopsy was ok, although I was freaking out. Doc gave me Xanax to help with the anxiety.  It is normal and I only hope that you are B9!
Posts.Title: new here with questions

Posts.Content: So after a mammo, needle biopsy and a surgical biopsy, this is the confirmed Dx.  My doc is referring me to a risk specialist to determine if I need to go on Tamoxifen.  Does anyone have any experience with this drug. I heard about the side effects, one being menopause which I am not ready for. I don't even have kids yet.
Posts.Title: Atypical Lobular Hyperplasia

Posts.Content:
Frayda,
I wish your mom a successful treatment and give lots of hugs.

Posts.Content: That's great!!! You must be so relieved. I too had a good result!
Posts.Title: Biopsy result - Great News!

Posts.Content: Susan 38-Just turned. NY Married to an amazing man.  No cancer, but atypical lobular hyperplasia. Or Lobular Carcinoma in Situ OK, what does that mean? I thought Carcinoma was cancer?? Will go to the High Risk doc Monday to determine whether to go on Tamoxifen. Don't want to...it may hinder my ability to have kids. Nervous but happy I found this place.
Posts.Title: ROLL CALL name, age, state and any other info to share

Posts.Content: Thanks for the reply-it was taken out, but Carcinoma is cancer and this is not cancer...I don't get it.
